page.title: 12ABLINGTON HAULIERS
page.content: The haulage business in Ablington of A. Bartlett & Sons has been carried on in the same family for 4 generations. It started on a small scale in the middle of the 19. Century to transport people by horse and trap, and to carry coal by horse and cart from the railway station at Fosscross to the large houses in the area. The business is now operated by two sons of the family who each drives a modern sophisticated lorry with lifting gear. The main goods transported are heavy building materials which are carried within a radius of 200-300 miles covering the West Country, South coast and as far north as Kettering and Northampton.
